string.text: Don't look so surprised marked one, I checked your PDA and saw the entry about Strelok. Look, I don't know what living hell you've come from or who you are for that matter, but if you help me, I'll help you. What do you say Marked One?
Well, at this moment in time, you seem like my best or only hope of finding this "Strelok" guy. Doesn't seem like I have much of a choice...
So, should I spoon-feed you like I usually do with all the rookies or maybe I can treat you like a real stalker and give you a mission straight away?
Treat me like a rookie, I don't remember anything.
I don't remember anything about myself, but I certainly do remember how to carry a weapon. So, how can I help you?
OK, thanks. How can I help you?
Thanks. What should I do now?
I see your pockets are empty, it's not a good idea to walk through the Zone without any equipment. So first, go back downstairs and get your stuff from the dresser.
Ok, I'll be back right now.
Done, so how can I help you?
Hurry up please, I have my own business to do...
One minute.
Any luck?
I have also uploaded the Personal Digital Advisor 2.0 application to your PDA. It will give you tips from time to time, teach you the basics for survival out there.

That's the spirit stalker! I'm starting to like you already. You got out of that Death Truck in pretty good shape too. Can't say the same for your PDA, there are some corrupted files, maybe due to some external damage. Oh, it still works, as you have seen, well, mostly. The maps are intact, you can check your notes and online contacts and whatnot. And at least you can still receive incoming messages - isn't that what counts, eh? Anyway, I haven't got a replacement for you so you're stuck with this one. Now, let's get down to business shall we? I don't know anything about you, boy, and I want to see if you're able to run some simple errands before I trust you with any real work. There's this artifact I need to close a business deal. Some rookies informed me that they saw one in this little bog not far from here - could be just the one I need. Check it out for me will you? Bring back the artifact and then we can talk some more.\n\nAnd one more thing: I also found this hickey of yours... a handcraft device that helps you detect artifacts. These used to be popular in the Zone, and now nobody gives a crap about them: everyone's trying to get something more decent. I've already dredged the detector up - and there's one thing I can say for sure: the database is deep inside. But it can still detect the simplest artifacts - so be glad! However, I'd actually recommend you to buy an "Echo": it's a lower class detecting device, yet it's way better than the thing you're holding right now. And there will be a discount for you - you got me for that.
I guess I can do that. I'm on my way!
I think I found what you were looking for.

Good, very good! You know, most guys would've run away with the swag and left me to the mutants! Now I see I can trust you.\nSpeaking of the devil, I think one of my contacts is in danger - probably spotted by the Military dogs. I would be grateful if you helped him. I really need the flash drive he's carrying, and I can't let it fall into the wrong hands.
If it isn't the survivor! If you want to ask something - go on.
Stalker! You finally woke up! I thought you would never get back to your senses!
Ohh... Such a headache... And who are you?
I'm Proverb, a local stalker. I found you in that truck a week ago.
What truck? Where is it now?
It was a Death Truck but now it's a complete wreck. It's on the far side of Cordon, close to the Garbage. I dragged you out of there all by myself and brought you to Sid.
That must have been a long way. You are a tough fellow!

You know, it's always good to help someone if you can. You never know from who and when you may need help, you know? What goes around comes around. Today I'm helping, and maybe I will need help tomorrow, and may God have mercy there will be someone to help me in time. And those bastards who don't care about anyone other than themselves usually join the ranks of the bandits. Who keeps company with pseudodogs, will learn to howl. Therefore, no one will would help such as those.
Thank you very much for saving me! I am in your debt.

Thank you as well, a kind word is better than any wealth, right? Although earning money in the zone is also necessary. Sidorovich gave me a couple tasks to clear out some mutants, and I think your assistance could be a good opportunity to recollect your hunting skills. If you help me now, that will square us with your debt to me.
Well, in this sort of outfit and with that gun I will not be able to take care of the mutants, which unlike everything else, I remember well.

What's wrong with the outfit? Not every newcomer has such. The eyes are afraid, but the deed is done by the arms. As for the weapons, I could help you with that. But it seems you've have some task from Sidorovich to complete. Get that job done first and then we'll talk.
Well, see you later, then. Although the Zone isn't a place where it's easy to make plans for the future, so let it ride. Well, I have to go.
Not really, I just wanted to say thanks again for saving me. Alright, see you later.
Well, business before pleasure. Time for some work.
Are you asking me to help or to do everything for you?

Monolith favours the brave. And he always rushes to the fore... and gets into the whirligig. Just help me; it's not like a little warm up will hurt. I think I've told that before... Don't count your crows before they are hatched.
You know I've just recovered from an amnesia, right?

Oh come on, don't get mad... By the way, hunting mutants with a pistol will get you killed fast. Every stalker knows that a shotgun is your best friend when dealing with them. Here, take my sawed-off for now, I don't use it anyway. Now, just follow me. Oh and don't be afraid of mutant. You know what they say - "He who fears every Burnt Fuzz must never go artifact hunting"!
This will be useful... but Sid asked me to find one of his contacts.
That guy?.. he never saw the heli coming! It's to late for him already, his body will be there later... rotting probably, ha! So help me first.
OK, onward.
Pretty beasts you've got here.
That's not all, let's clear out another place. What rookie's eyes fear is a piece of cake for a seasoned stalker.
Let's go.
Looks like we've done it. Man, these stink, making my eyes water.
If you can't stand the heat get out of the burner! So be strong. Yeah... that was some great teamwork.
So what's next?

Treat me as a friend - we're even now. Go now, do the thing Sidorovich asked you to do and here is a little something for your efforts. What? Yours look like something Sidor found on the bottom of a garbage bin.
Thank you and see you next time.
Alright, I'll go and check. But remember, I scratch your back...
Yes, yes! Now please hurry up. I marked his last known position on your PDA map.
By the way, did I have some equipment with me?
Ah yes, you had some things. I put them in the top of the wooden drawer downstairs. Take them. And remember, you are welcome to store your goods here anytime.
Ah, thanks.
On my way.
Your contact was dead, but I found his flash drive.
Phew, I needed this. Was there only one dead guy over there?
Yes, there was only one body.

Then I've got another job for you. There's a second guy that's probably in the factory above the hills - you've at least seen it in the distance, I'm sure. It's crawling with bandits, so he's surely dead by now, but I need his belongings as well as the place cleared of bandits. Talk with Wolf, he might be able to spare a few men for such a mission.
OK, I'll go see him.
Actually I went there already and killed all the bandits in sight.
Oh, ok well excuse me Rambo...Did you happen to spot a fallen stalker there with a special artefact on his person?
No, never found anything like that there.
Ok, please you must go back and find him and retrieve the stuff.
Ok, I'll go back there and see what I can dig up.
Sid says you might be able to help me deal with the bandits at the factory.
If information and coordinates are helpful to you.
Can't you spare a few rookies? It would make for a nice learning experience.

Petruha and his team can help you, if you insist. They've been raring to go and flush the scum out for awhile. I heard there is some kind of deal going down between the Bandits and this Merc named Mad Dog, hopefully you can take him out too! I can't spare anybody else though, so tough shit. Those Military bastards keep us on close watch - if they notice an opportunity, they'll storm our camp and slaughter us. Tell you what, if you kill those banditos, I'll give you a little reward as my personal thanks. How does that sound?
Wonderful, I'll go meet them.
Hey! What can I do for you?
The bandits at the factory are dead.
Great job. Sorry that I underestimated you mate! Did you get Mad Dog too? Here, take what I promised. Now we may be able to hold the factory for a while!
I saw Mad Dog, but he got away, looked like they were trading some artifact...Anyway, thanks for the reward, see you.
Can you answer some of my questions?
Sure, why not.
So you're the leader of this rookie camp?

Yes. I've been for a while now. It's tough sometimes since everyone seems to rely on you, but it's worth it. As long as the Zone exists, there will be someone taking care of the rookies here. I'm just another one.
Well, you`re doing a good job.
Why are you here?

Wasn`t anything left for me back home. Came here like any other rookie and made it all the way to the Army Warehouses. After making a little fortune for myself, I decided to come back here and coach the next generation of stalkers. I took it upon myself to take the position when the last leader died. He was a good man, that Valerian...
I see.
Who do you think will take up your mantle once you're gone?

Who knows? I've got a few candidates in mind, but in the end it's the rookies who decide. They are the ones who acknowledge a leader's power, after all. A leader without authority is as worthless as a dull razor.
Yeah that's true.
Do you have any family here?
I have a brother, Hound. He was always fascinated with the Zone and ran off to help the eggheads with their tests and experiments. Haven't seen him for long. I assume the Zone has him now.
Sorry to hear.
Do you wana know something else?
Do you know something about mercenaries? I saw one at the factory.

Really bad guys: maniacs, sadists and murderers. They killed a lot of stalkers for their own mercantile goals. Better not to deal with them, but if you'll meet this one from the factory, feed him with bullets for all our murdered comrades.
Got it.
I have another question...
I got into a tussle with the bandits at the factory and killed them all, hope you don't mind.
Yeah, Sid mentioned he sent you to me but I guess you were too eager to stop. Anyway, good job, here is a gesture of our appreciation.
Appreciate it, see you around.
Heh, a regular renegade eh? Well, we like people like you, here's a little something for you and from now on call me friend!
Appreciate it, see you around.
Hi, Wolf has already sent word of you. Do you have any questions?
Yes. How many bandits are in the camp?
Five or six. Most are inside the main complex, but I guess someone is patrolling the north entrance. Shall we say a prayer and go?
Yes, round up your men.
No, we'd make too much noise, I'll go on my own.
Hey, if you wanna play Rambo, go for it, I wont stop you. Just cry for help when you need it, ok hero?
We went hunting as a pack of wolves, and hunt we did! I bet Wolf will be pleased. Heh.
There's more of 'em! Find the bastards and take them down!
Whoa, man! Now that was something! You wiped them out and left nothing for us. I'd never believe it if I hadn't seen it with my own eyes! That blew me away, man...
So, where are the piles of enemies you killed? You talk the talk, but you don't walk the walk. Get lost!
I don't know who you are. Go and speak with Wolf at the village.
Ok, will do.
Your second contact was dead too. I found an artifact and PDA on his body.

Ah, come to Papa - the client was getting impatient over the artifact. As for the PDA, well... that's only for my lecherous eyes. Oh, and Marked One, when you've got the time I have something I'd like to discuss with you.
What was it you wanted to discuss?
If you insist on knowing, I have a delicate situation that needs tact. Still interested?
Explain, old man.

One of my contacts got himself in a pickle. His name is Fox. Maybe you've seen him before. For some reason, these "Sin" bastards have got him hostage. These guys... they look like zombies, but even worse. They talk, eat, drink and shit in the bushes like your normal guys, but they've got a ferocious glare to them - spooky stuff, even to veterans. Word of advice, Duty hates these guys with a passion... go there and see what they want, if you want to kill them, go ahead... Duty will probably let you in their ranks someday. If you see what they want and help them out, then Duty may never let you in. Try not to have a heart attack when you eyeball those Sin bastards!
I'll see what I can do about them.
What do you want, stalker?!
Can you tell me why you're holding Fox hostage?
Why the hell should you care? Got anything to say about it?
Sidorovich sent me to cut a deal with you, so chill.

Hah! So the bigoted fat idiot wants a deal? If he means it, then tell him our Boss wants the flash drive he has with "that" information. He'll know what we want. Now scram, before we just split your spine in half, twerp.
I'll try to ask him in nicer terms.
I've talked to them. They say you have a flash drive with "that" on it.

Hah-hah, should've known! I've heard that other traders are being coerced into handing them that kind of info. Hell, even when Duty is redoubling their efforts on finding their hideout, they have the balls to show up... Determined brats.
What type of information would Sin want from you guys?

About the hidden underground labs and experiments, that kind of shady stuff. They're obsessed with them. I've heard from Barkeep that they are searching for something in particular within them. The traders think it has something relating to their... condition. Maybe it's just makeup on their faces; I can't really say for sure. See, there's an unspoken rule around here to keep the whole "secret labs" thing minimal, unless it can help us head further North, past the Brain Scorcher. Otherwise, we've got to start asking ourselves some rather uncomfortable questions regarding the Zone and the experiments that were once performed here. It's Pandora's Box... \nAh, just forget about that boring old stuff, I'm just talking to myself here... Take the info back to our lovely friends and get Fox outta there. I got everything I needed out of it anyway. Tell 'em to stick it where the sun don't shine too if you can.
Oh sure, I will tell them that... if you want Fox back in pieces that is.
Here's what you wanted. Sid gives his "sincerest" greetings and wanted you to know it's useless to him anyways.

If he thinks we get teary-eyed over a sarcastic quip, then he's got another thing coming - that bunker door of his isn't impenetrable. Now, take that stalker out of here and don't come back, unless you like the taste of lead!
...OK, got it.
Nothing, I'll be back.
Nothing, just passing through. I'll be on my way.
You have no more business with us. Piss off!
Fine, see you.
I saved Fox, so what now?
Hey, good job with that. He came by to say hi and I didn't even see a hole in his body!
No big deal. So, have you found out anything about this Strelok character?
No big deal.

Indeed I have my friend. There is a stalker out there that goes by that name. Some say he has found a way North - a passage we traders have been seeking ever since we arrived here. I'd like to find out how he got there myself along with Barkeep and others. It's in an unexplored area, full of artifacts no doubt. Barkeep and I will help you find him, then maybe you will discover the hidden pathway too. It's a win-win situation for all of us: You will find Strelok and do whatever you have to, and we will open up a way to the northern reaches of the Zone. Personally I don't think you will find him, but there is a chance that you'll succeed where most have failed. Nothing ventured, nothing gained. Don't disapoint us, Marked One.
OK, so where can I start?
Seems a stalker named Seriy knows about him. He's hanging around the hangar in the Garbage. You should go talk to him.
OK, great, I'm on my way.
Hey, thanks for dealing with those Sin guys, real ugly bastards!
I've seen worse before... I think.

Anyway, the name is Fox. I'm the mechanic around these parts. If you need anything repaired or fine-tuned such as suits and weapons, I can do it for a price. Though I'll be sure to give you a nice discount after what you've done for me.
Well, thanks... sounds good.
Hey, Marked One! What can I do for you?
You are able to fix weapons and suits, right?
Yes, I will repair everything you will bring me. Of course, you have to pay me, minus the discount I'll give you. I can also tweak your gear and install upgrades to better whatever you have.
I see.
Hi Fox!
So how many contacts do you have?
Oh, since you mentioned contacts, I need you to find one guy - name's Nimble.
Why do your contacts always get into trouble?
This guy isn't exactly my contact... Let's say, he does a special job for me: that kind of job which you can't give to the usual boneheads. That's why I value him.
I could search for him if you gave me more information on where to do it.

Last time he had contacted me, he was already here on Cordon, near the bridge. He has good relations with the military at the bridge - they always let him pass, - so I don't think there could be any trouble. But he'd disappeared anyway.
I'll do my best, but I have no idea where could he have gone... thus, no guarantees.
I really hope you'll find him... Alright, go look for him. I'll be looking forward to hearing news from you.
People! Is there anyone around here?!!
Who are you? Why are you sitting in there?
I'm just a Stalker! A poltergeist got me locked, it holds the door. I can't get out. Help, please! Kill this monster so I can open the door!
There are many poltergeists around here. Alright, wait a little, I'll take care of them.
Howdy, stoller, feeling better already? How long have you been here? Is it you who people call Nimble?

Yes, that's me! I've been here for 2 days already. Still have some food left, but it got hard to breathe. The vent isn't working down here. Are you the guy who was brought unconsciouss right to the village?
Yes, it's me. We better talk about this later, don't want to be locked here together, right?
Yeah, that's right, God knows what else may creep around here.
Phew, seems like we're out. It's good news for Sidorovich, he was getting worried about you.

Did you seriously believe the old man that he worried about me? Ha! His only interest is money, he has no care about human life. Yes, maybe I'm more important to him than other stalker that work for him, but it's because I always get things done. But he sends me to such shitty places, it's hard not to shiver when I think about them!
But he did send me to find you after all.

He just needs the results of my last task, that's all. I won't tell you the details, I'll just say that I stole lots of information, from the military and a little from other places. Hacked several computers...
Why wouldn't you stop working for him?
That's not your business, alright? You believe I want to work for the old man? Life can be complicated so I don't have another choice. I won't find better money than Sidorovich pays.
You could go after rare artifacts, you are Nimble after all! Or join mercenaries.

I've big issues with anomalies. I don't feel their presence. I'm using my detector all the time and keep damn far distance between me and those damn traps. And I'm never going to kill people just for money! I have an old idea though, but I can't get it working on my own...
Your own business?
You could say so. For now, here's what we are going to do: you go tell Sido that I'm fine and unharmed while I go get some decent sleep. After that, come talk to me, we'll discuss my business plan.
Okay, just don't get into another shitty situation on your way back.
I've completed the task: Nimble is in a safe place, alive and in good health. Or not exactly in good... anyway, you can ask him yourself.
Yeah, very funny. I know Nimble is already here. Thanks - and here's your reward.
See you.
You said something about a special task?
Yes, I did... but you're not the guy to get it done: you already had a beef with the military - while I need to do everything as quiet and under-the-radar as possible.
Couldn't you have said it before? Yeah, I just lost my time because of you...

Yeah, there is something special: it's about the flash drive you brought. That data isn't so interesting... but if the Sinners are interested, then it seems like the information is correct and the military laboratories actually do exist. Besides, a group of military stalkers have brought a case from somewhere deep in the Zone. I don't know what's inside the case but I really want to find out. There's a chance the case may have important documents about the labs or something like that. It's a task of high importance.
I understand, but how can I steal something from a place that is swarming with military?

You'll have to go during the night, along with the fence. Only that way! There's a breach in the fence, go through it and climb into the barracks through a window. That way, you will sneak in swimmingly. You'll get out the same way, got it? I drew the map from words of my contact specially for such case - I'll upload it to your PDA. And another thing: I won't help you if you'll get caught or if you kill some of the military. Do it quiet and there won't be any trouble.
Alright, wish me luck then.
That was quite dangerous. Here is the case, really heavy.

Excellent, Marked One! Well... let me take a look. I've just seen a glimpse of it and already getting goosebumps from reading it! Everything is mixed together so it's impossible to make a clear picture out of this, but they always mention Agroprom in these documents. It's written: "According to the experiment results in Agroprom Research Institute it seems..."
What do you think to do now with this data?

I could say, there's no "information". Almost every second page is missing. Besides, from what's left, half of the records are damaged, no way you can read them. But I'm eager to find more, perhaps it will help us to solve this problem with the Center of the Zone.
What's our next move?
We will do it this way. You go where you were headed while I try to make something out of these documents. I'll contact you once I arranged a new task.
I'm here to talk about the Agroprom docs.
Anything wrong?
I haven't found anything. And I won't look anymore.
Why's that?
I don't have time for it: there's some business, like finding Strelok.
I haven't found anything yet, but I'm working on that.
That's good, Marked One, I'm waiting for the results.
Um... that's not much. Well, It's better than nothing. We - Barman, Petrenko and I - have already discussed this matter. So go to them for further instructions.
Good, I see. Wait, will there be any other task from you?

No, that's all. These Sinners made clear that I should keep away from this business; I'll give them everything you've found. But you can still bring me some artifacts, if you want. I'm currently in need of these: "Battery", "Shell", and "Spring".
Great, I can bring you them - for a good reward.
Alright, I've got to go. Bye.
No, I don't want to do this, I have my own stuff to do.
Well, as you want. Alright, go do your business.
Here's everything I found.

Well yeah, that's really interesting. And... there's nothing specific. Almost. It only says they've got some materials from another facility. Very interesting. We - Barman, Petrenko and I - have already discussed this matter. But there are many gaps... seems like all the Zone was just a testing ground of military and scientists.
What's next?

First off, bring the case to Barman. And then... I've digged much, but the Sinners made clear that I should keep away from this business. So I'll stop that, but there's just one place I want to check before that - the old mine in the Forest; perhaps there are some documents left. So, head there and grab everything you can... but don't bring it here - to Petrenko instead; he'll be pleased.
I see. Well, at least the info is much more clear this time. I'll search for it.
Alright, I'll look for somebody else to do the job.
Just like ordered - the three artefacts.
Good, Marked One. Well, I can offer you either good ammo or money. What do you choose?
Give me the ammo - I have enough money for now.
What type ammo will you take?
Give me 5.45 - old but gold.
5.56 is just what I need.
I would take 9x39.
I need something different, give me the 7.62x54.
Here you go:
Just give me the money - I have enough ammo.
Hey. I'd like to ask you about something.
Yes, go on.
You're not military, are you?

Yes, mate, you got that right. Not in the military, and I never wanted want to join the regular army back in the day: I was hiding from authorities. What's to hide? It's not like I feel bad about it, to be honest. Of course I'm not a former Spetsnaz since I managed to evade national military service; neither I'm one of the hunters - I've never slept in a tent - not even starting on resting in a sleeping bag in the base of a fallen tree. I know most of stalkers here got some sort of background and a load of skills which help them survive, but I - don't.
So, you're sort of wunderkind, am I right?

No, that's a miss. I'm a waif with a lot of thieving experience and some criminal records; had to run here to avoid the jail - the last job wasn't done properly, left lots of trails... No one here knew about my past, and it wasn't hard to look like a nice guy to others. And then I got into this trouble... I could never get rid of this 'nice funny young guy' appearance, damn it. I had to keep myself that way: nimble, wingbag, friendly, and always ready to help the troublesome comrades. I chose this "skin" and it got stuck on me, like I was hypnotized, infected with some virus. I don't feel myself the same way as before; I'm really ready to help someone out: have a talk about the life, listen to people...
So you sort of decided to start another life?

I wouldn't say I did - there was no decision; it all just... happened. I'd be glad to say my conscience woke up, but I'm still having nightmares: the past doesn't let me go, I run but can't get away... I'd gladly say I went here to redeem my sins, but damn - it never was like this: I entered as one person - but became a different one for some anomalous reason. The stalkers keep saying it must've been the Zone that changed me, they keep brainwashing me for almost a year now: "Look, the Zone accepted you and made you a better man". Well, that is my story, maybe it will give you something to think about. I didn't change, but came out entirely different man...
You got some other questions?
What can you tell me about the Zone?

It's a strange place. What can I tell you? I'm a great example of why is is strange. Seems like I was supposed to find my death on the day of arrival; I got a rest in an old bus on the Garbage vehicle junkyard... starting to make sense, right? No doubt I was supposed to rot the day after with such doze of radiation stalkers measured there later. However, only my Makarov pistol and my flip-knife went nuclear. My old companions, always kept them close. Had to throw them away...
Ever went deep in the Zone?

Yeah, I did - accidentally: wandered much. For example, I happened to see the Pripyat sign with my own eyes - I was wandering in its vicinity. When I got some artifacts from there and took them to Sid's desk, our chief haggler nearly died of surprise. The folks started to think of me as some kind of a charm: they got the habit of shaking hands with me before going out there. I don't watch them, but they are all living to this day, or so they say. Well, it's pretty simple actually: the mindset does it all. You're not a fan of mystics, I hope? I don't need another newbie squeezing my hand again.
All the strange stuff aside, what the Zone is?

It's a place where you have to appear humble and poor: good gear is seen from afar. Sooner or later, you'll get yourself robbed and naked in some shithole - and maybe even get a bullet in your head. I said that because you really need good equipment. With our local fauna and the frickin' bandits you won't last long without the decent gun and armor under the jacket. Screw the criminals, but sometimes even a good friend of yours can backstab you... The thing is, you shouldn't show your gear off. Like, never. All the strange things apart, the Zone is the place where you should get your things off in the bushes, and then go to the folks around the campfire. I already have a dozen of such bushes around - I should set up a shop... an idea of which I already have.
What are your thoughts on Sidorovich?

Seasoned dealer. He won't let his profits go - well, it's pretty usual for a trader who won't let his business down. You should have a knack for trading, so to speak. I'll tell you what, nick down: behind a good-natured windbag, there is a shadow of a sneaky bastard. He can get rid of somebody as easy as pick his nose... don't even ask me how I know that - just remember what I've said. Sooner or later he'll be put down, but I think it'll more likely to happen much more later than sooner.
Why did you get hired by him?

I can't say I've been hired: I work for anyone who gives tasks with reasonable rewards. To be honest, Sid turns out to be just the man for that, most of the time. Also, there's a tactical move - and I didn't come up with it - that you should keep your enemies closer. The tasks themselves tell much about his business: how far his arms reach out, and where they haven't been yet. The most interesting thing is who he is afraid of. There is one well-known person, with whom he is careful to the bootlicking. If you hang around for a longer time, you'll get who I'm talking about.
Do you know anything about Strelok?

It's more interesting to ask you why would you even care about him. But I'll tell you about him, not much though. Just don't have anything to do with fanatics such as Strelok, those guys who always circle around the Center of the Zone, and some even say they were lucky to get to the center. You can't expect that such a story will end well, right? If the Zone has these barriers which prevent people from going to the Center, they mean it isn't welcoming anyone who gets that far. Strelok was one of those uninvited guests, a fanatic. Forget about him for your own sake - this is all I know about Strelok and his group, fanatics and those who cheer for such individuals.
And what do you think about the factions?

Oh, that's another story. I'm not interested in that, and I wouldn't advise you to join any. It's easier to be a loner. There were some guys; they said, "We want to study the Zone from the inside". Took me in, despite my past. Turns out, they just needed the cannon fodder - their entire top brass are complete psychopaths: ruined the whole faction, although there were many good men... So, I'm not into that anymore. Came here, to the Cordon, when the faction was no more, and made myself quite living. I'm afraid to meet someone of them, won't tell you why.
I don't have any more questions, thanks for the answers.
You are welcome, come around to have a talk if you want.
Hi! Rested well? I'd like to discuss this "business plan" of yours.

Yes, Marked One, I wanted to talk about it as well. The risk isn't longer worth the rewards, so I won't work for Sidorovich. I got plenty of contacts around the Zone, found out a lot. Now it's time to take action, but I need a partner.
I'd gladly help you, as long as I get my part of the profits.

So, the plan is quite simple. I can't compete with Sidorovich but I know his weaknesses. He always sells common goods of lower quality. But you can never buy something really worthy, reliable or rare. That's why I want to take a part of his clients - experienced Stalkers who want decent gear for their money.
You won't find many experienced Stalkers in the rookie village.
Yes, I know, that's why I'm first going to populate my stock with wares, and then move on to a place with people who can pay well.
And what do you need of me?

Rare weapons and armor. Any self-made or professional modifications are good, the only condition is that it should be better than the usual stuff. You are confident with the weapons, you're more experienced than anybody in this camp. So we do everything simple: I give you a job to find a weapon, you get'em. Sometimes it'll be hard.
I see. Well, yeah, that suits me.
There are no contracts now, sorry.
What did you want to talk about?
Here's the payment:
What about the job?
Now we have these contracts:
What'll the first job be?

Yeah, there is one. Listen carefully: There are military quarters on the territory of the former Research Institute, to the west of the Garbage. I don't understand what they're doing there, although I have some thoughts on that. But that's not what interests me. I precisely know that their leader, who knows his rank, has an interesting gun. Like the common "Groza", but adapted to the 5.45 ammo and with an extended clip. Very handy thing. We'll discuss the payment later.
Well yeah, it's just the matter of three minutes: steal the favourite gun of the military outpost's head, considering I don't even where it is. Alright, I have to go.
Listen, Nimble, I don't want your tasks anymore.
I see. Have you thought it through? If you refuse, there's no more work for you. But know this - I'll establish my business even without your help.
Yes, I refuse!
Although... No, I changed my mind. I'll look for that Groza of yours...
Take your "Groza"! I've decided not to keep it.

Wow, finally! Oh well, I have to fix it up. But there's one problem... I don't have the money to pay for it, we have to find a buyer first. So you can chose: \n Either trust me and get your payment later. \n Or keep the gun, but I won't work with you anymore.
Alright, damn you. Take it, but remember that you owe me.
Nah, that's not going to work. No money - no gunney. I'm sorry, but it's impossible to work on pure trust.
Great. So, will you go with me? I know where to stash it. And the other stuff that I have. Well, I'll go in any case, you can join me if you want.
Well yeah, let's go.
No, I've got something to do.
Good luck then.
So what about the next task?
I don't mind working some more. What's next?
Nah, that's enough for now.
Then listen carefully: there's one criminal bigshot, the one called Borov. Huge guy. Always carries a big revolver around. That's the gun I need. He's at the bandits base in the Dark Valley.
One task harder than the other. At first, the gun of the military head, then the bandit leader's gun. Alright, I'll go.
Well, what do you say?
That's the place, where I stash the things. Nobody goes here, and I've spiced up the whole thing after that poltergeist accident. Even if somebody comes here, he won't find anything.
So what, you'll be trading here?
No, I'll get some more goods, and then I'll go to the Bar. I have enough contacts already, everything's set up. Alright, let's get out of here, it's creepy here.
Yeah, let's go.
Wait... Will you take a job?
Alright, why not?
Sometime later, I've got something else to do.
Well, can you already pay me for "Groza"?
Nah, sorry, there was no buyer yet.
Yeah,I just wanted to tell you. I've found the buyer, he has already made a prepayment. So that money is yours.
Alright, I'll come later.
Great, it's good to have a spare cash.
Listen, Nimble, I changed my mind about looking for that revolver.
Chickened out? Your circus, your monkeys. Refuse and I won't work with your again.
My pride won't suffer, I won't work anymore.
Your know what... I think I changed my mind, I'll finish what I started. Maybe...
Here's the revolver! It wasn't easy to get it.
I already got tired of waiting. We are working under the old scheme. There will be no money yet.
Well, then I'll keep it for myself, that's a great revolver.
Good luck to you then and farewell.
Take it. Money is good, but friendship is better.
Come visit me later then. We'll make it even. So, do you want more work?
Yeah, of course.
That's enough for me, I'll go get some rest.
So, can you already pay me for the "Magnum"?
So, can you already pay me for the "SP-100M"?
I'm ready for another job.

Okay. I'll be brief: my intel says that besides the suits scientists wear now, SSP-99 and SSP-99M, there's another version of that suit, designed before the Blowout. You should look for it at Lake Yantar. Ask Sakharov, he can surely help you.
I hope that I won't have to get to the radioactive spots to find the mythical suit.
I want to stop working for you.
Why's that? Remember: if you refuse, I'll stop trusting you, and consequently stop giving you jobs.
Yes, I understand that, but I have to refuse.
I changed my mind, I'll continue searching for that suit.
Here's the suit. That was the hardest one to get! You'd be surprised if you was the things from the lake's underground!
And you'd be surprised by the reward... when I get the money for it. Deal?
Yeah, I know the drill.
Come later then, we'll get even.
What's the next task?
There's nothing at the moment: I need to sort something out now. I'll let you know once I've done. Oh, there was some key in the pocket: take it - might be useful.
Hey Nimble. Could you tell me something?
Why not? Ask away.
Do you know anything about Garik?
To be honest, I don't. Can you imagine how many stalkers are there with such nickname? That's just a name, though, not a nickname.
Yeah, you're right, but I have to find him anyway.
Good luck then.
Tell me about...
What do you want to know?
Anything you know about Strelok?

Nothing much, mostly rumors and speculation. They say he's one tough customer and has a few mates. Personally, I've never seen the guy, or maybe he wore a gas mask if I did - wouldn't really know. Seems like a VIP type of person with good contacts, so I doubt he's seen on a regular basis, or that people would even know who he is if they did catch a glimpse.
Tell me about the Zone.

One day, years ago, back in 2006, it popped up here in Chernobyl. That's what everyone knows. Here's my free advice: Do your best to avoid mutants, stay out of anomalies, and don't come close to stalkers you don't know, especially those in dark uniforms - never a good sign.
I need weapons and equipment, where can I get these?

I can sell you those. I feel great potential in you... So, for you, as my friend and partner, I will make a concession and sell them cheaper. Be happy that Uncle Sid's got your back - people usually pay for that...
I need money. How can I earn it in the Zone?

Fulfill my tasks, bring me artifacts, or do odd jobs for the local stalkers - factions as well, they've got resources thus bigger pays. I will pay you well though, not like some others hucksters and wannabes. There are other traders around like Barkeep in the deeper parts of the Zone, even secret ones with special liaisons. That is, if you even get there!
Who are those Freedom guys?

They are anarchists and thugs with a hint of style, for the most part. A few decents folks in there like anywhere, but try avoiding them if possible. That's my suggestion though. Bunch of depraved potheads and sodomites...
What do you know about Duty?

They hunt down mutants and Sin stalkers alike, and aren't really interested in newbies. If Freedom is chaos, they are order. They are militaristic in their ways and believe it is their "Duty" to protect the Big Land from the Zone's horrors. Which means that they harass artifact smugglers, which makes my job that much harder, and that gets me quite irate. The price you get from the Ecologists is nice, but black market deals are twice as lucrative! Lucky for us traders, Duty still take bribes and they've slacked off on those type of ventures. Heh-heh.
What the heck is this Death Truck thing, and who got me out of there?

Death Trucks are kind of a mystery to everyone. They just drive themselves from the Zone's center all the way to Zone's borders. Almost nobody get out of these alive. By the way, the guy who saved you was a nice one: bodies with a tattoo like yours are usually sold as research material - the eggheads want these for some reason... what a bunch of maniacs!
Where's the old factory?
It's right here, a little jog from this den. I'll highlight it on your map.
Thanks, that'll be it for today.
I remember a strange word - "transmutation".
Yeah. Advanced Stalkers use a specific device to change artefacts somehow, though I am not sure what benefit it can give... My old friend at the Bar knowns more about it. Ask him.
Hey, fatty. I need info.
You're risking to lose my loyalty, frickin' joker! Alright, relax. So you want to get it for free? Well, that depends on what you want to ask.
Do you know something about some stalker named Garik?

Well, I can tell you something: I've heard that he's a experienced stalker, though he's young. Doesn't like to stand still; always looking for new paths and passages. I'd even worked with him a couple of times: if you need to get a rare artifact fast - he's the one to do the job. But I don't know how to contact him - he used to just come here occasionally. And what has actually happened?
He's missing and I'd want to find him: it's a personal matter.
Huh.. that's not good. Then look for him in the center of the Zone; in some dangerous places.
Well, thanks for that.
This area is off limits, stalker.
But I need to go there.
Tough luck. Unless you REALLY need to go, then the price is 500.
Here you are.
Now listen up. We'll pretend for a moment it's nothing but mosquitoes and butterflies around here. What happens beyond this point is your own damn business.
Alright, keep moving! Get your ass outta here, before we change our mind.
I don't have that kind of money.
Then go back where you came from and get it. And don't you try and sneak past us, you hear? Trust me, it's not worth dying for.
Stalker, we don't let anyone go through right now! If you don't want any trouble, turn and walk away.
Got it, I'm leaving.
Hi, can you tell me a bit about where I am?
Hey, you seem new around here, welcome. I am Wolf, leader of the stalkers in these parts. This is the exclusion zone`s cordon.
Hi, thanks Wolf. So this is the start of the 'zone' so to speak?
Yes, if this were a mountain, you would be at it`s base, and believe me, it`s a long climb to the top!
Thanks, I`ll keep that in mind. See you around perhaps.
Hey, do you have any other jobs for me?
I do have a little job for you if you are interested.
Give me the run down.

I lost a key in the underground tunnel near Petruha's old camp. I was sleeping in one of the rooms close to the entrance and when I woke it was gone. Must have fallen out my pocket. It opens a wagon in Garbage near the entrance to the Bar. I stashed a whole lot of stuff in boxes in the wagon. Find the key and the stash is yours. Return the key to me and I will give you an added bonus. What do you say?
Sure, I'm up for it.
Sorry I have important things I need to do.
So, you found the key?
Not yet, still looking.
Sure did.
Did you go get the stash?
Not yet, I'll get it soon.
Not yet, but take the key, I don't have time to go there.
Ok, well, if you're sure. Oh and here is what I promised for returning the key.
I am, see you later.
Yes I did, thanks for that.
No, thank you for finding my key, and here is the added bonus I mentioned.
Sweet thanks, see you later.
Hey Wolf. Can I ask you something?
Yeah, go on.
Do you know anything about the stalker called Garik?
Yeah, I think that's one of Barman's bodyguards... or not?
Yeah... no, that's not the one I need. Thanks anyway.
So, you're the one who can repair everything?

Well, "everything"? Not really. I am an amateur when it comes to repairs. Been fixing things and building stuff since I was a kid. One day my grandpa showed me his shotgun, told me how to maintain it - I've been repairing guns since then.
So can you repair any gun?

Actually, no. I don't even try to tamper with NATO guns. And, if you think of it, the Abakan is not as simple as it looks. But what I can repair are shotguns and pistols: I have become very proficient with those actually, can upgrade them so you wouldn't recognize them.
And what about outfits?

It's not so simple either... You might have noticed that everybody around here wears simple jackets, and patching up a jacket is no big deal. But I don't have the materials for suits. My prices aren't high, the business isn't developing and I can't afford to stack up on materials. What we do, is if anyone wants me ro repair his suits, he orders materials, and I set them aside in the storage for him.
Yeah, that sounds a bit complicated... Do you have any other issues here?

I also lack tools to make upgrades. As you have surely noticed, the folks around here don't really want to upgrade their gear, so the demand isn't high. Again, it's all down to money - I won't charge a lot - that's my principle - so I am in the black. But I can't afford buying expensive tools, and folks ain't gonna credit me. I did offer Wolf to chip in, but he refused.
What if I help you?
Then you'll get a huge discount! But keep in mind: the tools are very expensive.
I need to think about it. I'll let you know if I make up my mind.
I am here for repairs...
Yep, what you got?
I want to order materials for suits.
Ok, I'll forward the order to Sidorovich as he is dealing with that. I don't think it'll take long, not more than a day. That's gonna be 7500.
Alright, here you go.
Affirmative. When the materials come in, I'll be able to fix and upgrade your suits.
Wait, I don't have so much on me right now. Let's try another time.
Well, it's you who wants something. In any case, I'll always help if I can.
I changed my mind, today is not the time for this.
I want to order materials for weapons.
Okay, I'll send the order to Sidorovich. He is responsible for it. It does not take a lot of time, especially if he already has these materials. You owe me 5750.
Here you go.
Affirmative. When the materials arrive, I'll be able to fix and upgrade your weapons.
Eh, it seems I don't have enough dough on me. I'll see you another time.
Your circus, your monkeys. In any case, I'll always help if I can.
Wait, I changed my mind. That's little too expensive for me now, let's try later.
I would like to discuss the situation with your tools.
The situation is simple, I need tools for fine work and for calibration. I couldn't buy them myself, I need an associate. Let's just say it's a risk that I am willing to go.
And you'll give me a discount if I'll help you?
Yes, a great discount. If you're going to use my services, it'll pay off anyway, right? We'll chip in 50-50.
Let's buy the tools for fine work then.
Great. According to my calculations, the complete set will cost no less than 55 thousand, so your part would be 27500.
Here's 27500.
Here's 27500.
Good. Thanks for very much for all your help. Come back later when the tools arrive.
Wait, 27500... I don't have that much, I'll tell you if I'll scrape enough together.
Understood. But thanks anyway.
Wait, I changed my mind. I can't afford such an expense now.
I'm offering to buy the tools for calibration.
Yes, that would be nice... but very expensive. This set will cost at least 100 thousand rubles. Split in half, that'll be 50 grand each. What do you say?
What's there to think? A needed purchase. Here, my share, 50000.
So expensive. I don't have that much now. Maybe later, you can't get so much immediately.
Buying from Sidorovich is not always a good decision. Do you have any other ideas?

Hmm... actually, there is something: I heard that bandits had their own mechanic at the factory. They've been wiped out, right? You should go and look there for tools - maybe they'd left something in a hurry.
Yeah, now we're talking! And there you were ready to throw 55 grand away.
That's a shame, but I understand: that's a lot of money.
Perhaps I can get them somewhere else? Like, another way? Do you have any ideas?
I've got none. But I'd be grateful, if you found the tools.
Hi, I've got something for you.
Yeah, what is it?
Got you the advanced tools.
Here are the calibration tools.
Here's some data on military armor.
Here's a schematic for modern suits with a closed cycle breathing system.
I've got you something special: everything you've wanted to know about the last generation military SKAT suits.
Here's some Exosuit documentation. Useful stuff.
Great! There are just calibration tools left.
That's good! Now I need advanced tools.
Well, that's all. I've got the full set. Now I can start work for sure!
Wow! Valuable data. Thanks a lot!
It's simple: there are just advanced tools left. I can't afford them myself, so I need a partner. That's a risk I'm willing to take, so to speak.
It's simple: there are just calibration tools left. I can't afford them myself, so I need a partner. That's a risk I'm willing to take, so to speak.
I already have the advanced tools - here you go.
I already have the calibration tools - you can keep them.
I see. Try to find tools at the factory, alright?
I already have everything I needed. Thank you very much! And, as promised, now everything is half-price for you.
Well, screw these searches! I couldn't find advanced tools - let's just buy them.
Special delivery: the advanced tools.
I couldn't find advanced tools - let's just buy them.
Just for you: the calibration tools.
I have some info on G-36 and F-2000: schematics, descriptions and so on - all illustrated. Take a look if you want.
Here's some info on Abakan: you wanted to make it clearer, didn't you? Here it is.
Hey, I've got the whole schematics on the Gauss rifle! Don't ask where I got it.
The Gauss rifle? Are you serious? Thanks for the help, but I won't be able to figure it out.
You've said that you can help me with repairs.
Yes, of cource. I don't like to stay in debt. I will help with repairs but won't help with upgrades because my toolkits have been stolen. I have no idea who did it.
But what if I'll help you with the toolkits?
That would be great. With the toolkits I can upgrade your stuff as long as you can pay.
Deal.
I'm here about the toolkits.
What have you got?
I've got a toolkit for rough work.
I've got a toolkit for fine work.
I've got calibration tools.
Great! It would be awesome if I'd get a toolkit for rough work.
Great! I'd like to have a toolkit for fine work.
Great! But I really need some calibration tools.
Great! But I still need toolkits for rough and fine work.
Great! But I still need toolkits for rough work and calibration tools.
Great! But I still need toolkits for fine work and calibration tools.
That's it! Now I have a complete tool set, so we can upgrade everything you want!
Nothing, you have such tools already.
Hey stalker, how goes it?
Hi, haven't seen you here before.
Yes, my name is Fanatic, I am taking over leadership from Wolf since he has moved back to the factory.
Ah I see, ok, good to meet you.
